intro: Sphaerocephalus nanus, commonly known as the dwarf globular liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, globular growth form, with dense clusters of leaf-like structures called phyllodes. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short stalks and release spores for propagation. Sphaerocephalus nanus is often found in rocky or mossy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to humid, nutrient-poor conditions.
